channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Caitlin Clark is still drawing massive crowds to the WNBA, despite some bumps
item.description: Caitlin Clark, the top pick in this year's WNBA Draft, has electrified fans despite her team's struggles. She's also received her share of hard knocks from opponents and others.
item.content:encoded: Caitlin Clark, the top pick in this year's WNBA Draft, has electrified fans despite her team's struggles. She's also received her share of hard knocks from opponents and others.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Israel rescues 4 hostages in operation that kills over 270 Gazans
item.description: An Israeli rescue operation freed four Israeli hostages and, according to sources at a hospital in Gaza, resulted in the deaths of more than 200 people.
item.content:encoded: An Israeli rescue operation freed four Israeli hostages and, according to sources at a hospital in Gaza, resulted in the deaths of more than 200 people.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: How Biden's asylum policy is affecting one Venezuelan family
item.description: President Biden’s moves to temporarily halt most asylum claims at the southern border leaves one Venezuelan family in limbo, with one member in Florida and others waiting at the U.S.-Mexico border.
item.content:encoded: President Biden’s moves to temporarily halt most asylum claims at the southern border leaves one Venezuelan family in limbo, with one member in Florida and others waiting at the U.S.-Mexico border.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Jokisch Polo

item.title: An aid kitchen in Gaza is trying to stay afloat amidst growing restrictions
item.description: The aid group Rebuilding Alliance has relocated to central Gaza from Rafah and is struggling to feed people in need.
item.content:encoded: The aid group Rebuilding Alliance has relocated to central Gaza from Rafah and is struggling to feed people in need.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Politics chat: Biden seeks to differentiate himself from Trump
item.description: President Biden is seeking to contrast himself with former President Trump, who has been vowing revenge after his New York court guilty verdicts.
item.content:encoded: President Biden is seeking to contrast himself with former President Trump, who has been vowing revenge after his New York court guilty verdicts.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: The driving tactic that could make your morning commute easier
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Marshall Zelinger of 9News Denver about his reporting on and advocacy for zipper merging, a driving tactic that can ease traffic congestion.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Marshall Zelinger of 9News Denver about his reporting on and advocacy for zipper merging, a driving tactic that can ease traffic congestion.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: The price of some goods and services is still bringing Americans down
item.description: Gas prices are falling and employers are hiring but some good and services remain stubbornly expensive, resulting in mixed consumer sentiment.
item.content:encoded: Gas prices are falling and employers are hiring but some good and services remain stubbornly expensive, resulting in mixed consumer sentiment.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Romance Writers of America files for bankruptcy
item.description: The Romance Writers of America has filed for bankruptcy, saying it can't pay for conference spaces it booked up ahead of Covid and before several years of infighting and allegations of racism. What does this mean for romance writers and the growing fans of the genre?
item.content:encoded: The Romance Writers of America has filed for bankruptcy, saying it can't pay for conference spaces it booked up ahead of Covid and before several years of infighting and allegations of racism. What does this mean for romance writers and the growing fans of the genre?
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Bowen Yang invited Tina Fey onto his podcast. He's still dwelling on what she said
item.description: Bowen Yang talks to Wild Card about his proudest moment as a kid, hard truths from Tina Fey and why he thinks there's more to reality than we can see or touch.
item.content:encoded:
Bowen Yang talks to Wild Card about his proudest moment as a kid, hard truths from Tina Fey and why he thinks there's more to reality than we can see or touch.

(Image credit: Frazer Harrison)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Fake beauty queens charm judges at the Miss AI pageant
item.description: Ten models that exist only in the digital realm have made it to the finals of what's being billed as the world's first beauty pageant involving AI.
item.content:encoded: Ten models that exist only in the digital realm have made it to the finals of what's being billed as the world's first beauty pageant involving AI.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman
